intro: Bennettiodendron leprosipes, commonly known as the leprose bennettiodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces a milky latex sap, which is a common feature among members of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
